Container.Name: hapy-automation
Container.Overview:
Home Assistant Python Automation tool.
Automation flow execution for Home Assistant using Python. It comes with a self-discovery feature that generates Python modules where entities, devices and services are type-hinted and bound statically, so the IDE can provide auto-completion and type checking when creating automations based on state changes in entities or action triggers in devices (if using ZHA Plugin).
NOTE: First time the app runs, will output in console a public .ssh key that its needed to be added to the git's access keys. The key can be also found in mapped volume /mnt/user/appdata/hapy/.ssh

Config.Name: HA_API_URL
Config.Description: Home Assistant API url in the form: http://<homeassistant-ip>:<port>/api

Config.Name: HA_WS_URL
Config.Description: Home Assistant Web Socket API url in the form: ws://<ha-url>:<ha-port>/api/websocket

Config.Name: REPOSITORY_URL
Config.Description: URL to an empty git repository or a previous one used with this tool. ie: git@github.com:<user>/<repo-name>.git
